angles.headline: Sources: The 'Unified Command' Friction Behind the Scenes
angles.angle: While the press release sings 'unity' between SF, San Mateo, and Santa Clara agencies, my sources on the ground describe a turf war over motorcade jurisdiction. The 'handshake' protocols for team buses crossing county lines are still being debated, which is unheard of this close to kickoff. If they don't resolve the comms channel dispute, we could see a team bus stalled at a county line for 'security verification'.

angles.headline: The 'Green Zone' Credential Panic
angles.angle: The Phase III lockdown on Tasman Drive is causing havoc for vendors. I've learned that the 'Green Zone' credentials—required for any vehicle entering the secure perimeter after Thursday—were printed with a security flaw. Security directors are scrambling to issue digital overrides. If you see a delay in concession setups or field equipment arrival, this credential mix-up is the culprit.

local_angles.angle: The Tasman Lockdown: Surviving Phase II & III
local_angles.description: The City of Santa Clara just confirmed the nightmare: Tasman Drive is officially closed from Jan 28 to Feb 13. This isn't just game day traffic; it's a two-week infrastructure lockdown. If you rely on the VTA drop-off or rideshare at the main gate, you are walking into a bottleneck.
venues: San Tomas Aquino Creek Trail (The pedestrian bypass)
Lick Mill Blvd (The local escape route)
VTA Great America Station (The choke point)
local_angles.insider_tip: Avoid the 'Vehicle Detour' signs like the plague. Instead, get dropped at the Mercado center on Mission College Blvd, grab a burger at In-N-Out, and walk the Creek Trail north. You skip the entire security checkpoint queue at Tasman.
local_angles.fan_hook: The road closures started January 28th. Here is the map to beat the Phase III gridlock.

local_angles.angle: The Clean Zone Diet: Where to Eat
local_angles.description: With the 'Clean Zone' enforcement hardening the perimeter, delivery drivers are being turned away at the checkpoints. The stadium area is now a food desert unless you have a credential. We are mapping the 'Calories vs. Checkpoints' strategy for fans who want to eat real food before entering the bubble.
local_angles.insider_tip: Santa Clara Square is the golden zone. It is technically outside the vehicle hard perimeter, so you can park or Uber there easily, but it's a short 15-minute walk to the stadium gates. It's the best pre-game meetup spot that doesn't require a ticket.
local_angles.fan_hook: Don't get stuck eating $20 popcorn for dinner. Here are the best tables just outside the security wall.

local_angles.angle: Tailgating Under Watch: The Multi-Agency Shift
local_angles.description: The 'Multi-Agency Security Unification' is in effect, meaning SFPD and San Mateo units are patrolling Santa Clara lots. The vibe is stricter, and the Media Compound has swallowed half of Blue Lot 1. The party has moved, and the rules have tightened.
venues: Green Lot 3 (The new center of gravity)
local_angles.insider_tip: If you are in Green Lot 3, keep the aisles clear. The new multi-agency patrols are strictly enforcing fire lanes this year due to the density. The 'unwritten rules' of past seasons regarding open containers on the sidewalk are gone.
local_angles.fan_hook: The cops are united and the Blue Lot is gone. Here is where the real tailgate is happening for SB60.
